title: Negative rates or no, be wary of keeping your cash under the mattress
text: ”, August 31) suggests that one possible response to negative interest rates is for us to hold paper currency since no one has “ever offered negative interest rates on it before”. One proposal is to divide the monetary base into two “currencies”: cash and e-money, with a conversion rate between the two. To implement a deeply negative rate on cash, the conversion rate of paper currency in terms of e-money would be depreciated at the same rate as the negative rate on e-money, thus negating any benefit to holding cash instead of bank deposits.
